4.eng: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus
4.mlk: Kuna jai mooza ipeeka upejikeene kui’elewa kuhusu aka bhirusi bhya kud’a

13.eng: Keep your distance.﻿2m to 0.5m will keep you safe from large droplets.
13.mlk: Kaag hatua. Mita 2 ikud’uuna kukweeka usalaama na mata/ikololo yat’innkie.

17.eng: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:
17.mlk: Kwa aka iyyo guya oone mûûdû akokololee/hat’iseeni

18.eng: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby
18.mlk: Wanyiige kyiizi.  Wakokololela dhini ama kuhat’isîza dhini na wakiinge waalya chwee waa bira yaao

22.eng: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself
22.mlk: Anaafi daa moroghoti, nijai akukingee mîîlî

23.eng: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious
23.mlk: Waad waalya wa’ambukizizwe wakud’una kochowa konyisa d’alili, amû yiite wanaa maambukizi

24.eng: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.
24.mlk: Na kwa uj’umula, ni fai kukaagî kla na ummati wa waadû, maana da’ukud’uuna kumanya katî kaao ni ani yûû moroghoti.

32.eng: & even on the outside of your face mask
32.mlk: Na hata na b’atiini ya oso wa  kyiizi kyewwe

38.eng: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…
38.mlk: J’apokuwa wakati ûgî mataa mûûdû moroghoti yakud’uuna kut’innik’îla biyya zîgî…

42.eng: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,
42.mlk: Na guya udhaabhi b’llaa kutarazia b’aadhyaa sehemu îzi, na kisaana ukadhaabha oso wewwe,

43.eng: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.
43.mlk: Na gîla mooza muhimu hamu ya kuwamala ni kwa koosa na kuwacheeja na sab’uni, jiiki, ama boorte.

44.eng: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,
44.mlk: Bhirusi nijai bhikakaagî hubhîîni kwa mud’aa masa’a bhit’ook’o

47.eng: Which is why it is also good to follow these
47.mlk: Dûû manaa yûû muhimu kweera aya

48.eng: wash with soap up to here

51.eng: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.
51.mlk: Manya usaadhaabha oso wewwe. (ama oso wa mûûdû ûgî.) Guya yaakukub’idhi, osa nguzi mikono yewwe aka fai na sab’uni.

52.eng: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
52.mlk: Mud’a mufai wa koghoona ubhinaa ‘Sikwaa kubhyaalîka’ mara bîlî.

56.eng: wash the back of your hands

58.eng: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.
58.mlk: Guya ugheghezie aka iyyo, uswiite na wasiwasi. Ukisaana osa mikono yewwe na sab’uni.

59.eng: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.
59.mlk: Manya usaadhaabha kyiizi ikyo na b’atiini.

61.eng: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long
61.mlk: *Bakiteria nijai zika’enea kyiizi ikyo dhini guya ukifaazie kyiizi ikyo kwa mud’a mulaila

62.eng: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!
62.mlk: Llacha kyiizi guya oone kit’uraawie. Manya usaakufaala kyiizi ikyo zaid’yaa siku mooza!

67.mlk: Killaa mûûdû ipejikeene akwiita na taulwaa koowa yeyye mweenye.

68.eng: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.
68.mlk: Manya musaakulubhana ama kutumika wali bhiitû, hubhî, bhikombe, taulu.

69.eng: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried
69.mlk: Maana da’ud’uuna udhaabhe oso wewwe na chik’ilî hata guya uwakud’eema

70.eng: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.
70.mlk: Guya iwakud’unikana arhûlla na ufuuge babala ikiwa utumikee ch’ik’ilî yewwe ama ifuzi lyewwe bad’ilyaa kutumika mokono wewwe.

72.eng: and after being out in the public
72.mlk: Na hata ba’ad’a kwiita b’atiini na wadûû

74.eng: Always wash your hands with soap…
74.mlk: Osa mikono yewwe na maazî na sab’uni killaa wakati…

77.mlk: Killaa mûûdû na akaagî  na usalaama!

78.mlk: Killaa mûûdû na akaagî  na usalaama!

80.eng: Read the articles for more tips!
80.mlk: Soma nakala îyî ud’ak’abhe kumanya udhiina

81.eng: "This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)
81.mlk: “This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel” by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)

82.eng: "The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)
82.mlk: “The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe”, by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign policy, Report.  (Jan 25, 2020)

83.eng: "How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020
83.mlk: “How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands”. By Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, opinion.  (Jan 28,2020)

85.eng:
Additional notes:  Hygiene precautions in comic are effective in preventing many other common infections such as flu and cold, and should be applied in every day life, even when there is no epidemic. 
References:  lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVI 019 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references. ﻿https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/ ﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-1O
Additonal lnformation  A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here:﻿﻿https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Sharing Guidelines  This comic is free for the general public to share online and through Whatsapp and Telegram, and the downloads are free for printing out as posters for personal and educational use in homes, schools, and workplaces. 
When sharing, please remember these 3 points: ﻿1) No edits to the comics is allowed in any way when sharing.﻿2) Comics cannot be used for any commercial project﻿3) lf online, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow
﻿For all other uses, please send a request in to: comicsforgood@gmail.com
85.mlk:
Kifungu kya koogeza: Kuzingatia usafi kwa umakiini kwa komiki kuna umuhimu wa kwiizîza ma’ambukizi yagî yamanyikeene kamaa k’annû na bepo, na ipejikeene kuzingatiywa na kutekelezwa katîka maisha ya killaa siku, hata guya kusakoona j’anga lya roghoti. 
References: lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references.  https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/  https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Additonal lnformation A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here: https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Kwaaba mwoongozo Umma kwa uj’umula nijai wakapeewa Komiki  îyî b’asi aka wakuitumika mitandao yaao dhini ya Whatsapp na  Telegramu, na kupakua kweyye lîa ni b’asi aka id’una kuchapishwa aka ikweekwa mab’angooni dûû waadû wakutumika binasu ama itumike kwa golaa kubarsiisisa mizîni, sukuli na hata  biyyaa ghiiryû balîî balî. 
Guya okonyisee wagî, ûkûcha rhaalî zingatia mambo aya matato: 1) Da’irughusizwe kwa aka yoyote kuhariiri komiki wakati utumikee na wagî. 2) Komiki da’itumikee kwa murad’i wowote wa kib’yashara 3) Guya yûû mutandaoni, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow
Kwa waalya wagî chwee watumikee, mûkûcha rhaallî botaa ombi lyeenu kwa: comicsforgood@gmail.com

90.eng: Created by Weiman Kow, instagram: weimankow

bookText.eng:
About Coronavirus



There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus
SPREADS
Mouth
Nose
Eyes
Get into your
Healthy Person
Sick Person
The virus spreads when ﻿these droplets
Keep your distance.﻿2m to 0.5m will keep you safe from large droplets.
1
2m-0.5m
Achoo!
So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:
Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby
2
Thank you﻿*sniffles*
OR,
Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself
People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious
And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.
chopsticks
Healthy person
Train straps
Lift buttons
Tissues
Cups
Digital devices
& even on the outside of your face mask
Stair bannisters
Mouse
Pens
Door knobs
Their hands
However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…
you might all fall sick.
or your loved one's face
rub eyes
And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,
and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.
Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,
soap
precautions
Which is why it is also good to follow these
wash with soap up to here
soap
elbow
Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.
Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
under the nails
for 20 seconds
between the fingers
wash the back of your hands
What is thoroughly?
If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.
Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.
droplets
*Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long
Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!
Use a serving spoon
Baby
Daddy
Mommy
Everyone gets their own towel
Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.
You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried
Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.
Home
and after being out in the public
Before you eat
Always wash your hands with soap…
And finally,
soap
Stay safe, everyone!
Stay safe, everyone!
soap
Read the articles for more tips!

"The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)
"How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020

Additional notes:  Hygiene precautions in comic are effective in preventing many other common infections such as flu and cold, and should be applied in every day life, even when there is no epidemic. 
References:  lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVI 019 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references. ﻿https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/ ﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-1O

bookText.mlk:
Kuhusu bhirusi bhya Kud’a

Translated by Fatuma Ali

Kuna jai mooza ipeeka upejikeene kui’elewa kuhusu aka bhirusi bhya kud’a
KU’ENEE
Kanweeni
Bûleeni
Machooni
yakakupacha
Mûûdû anaa jinna fai
Mûûdû moroghoti
Bhirusi bhika’enea guya mata yakut’innik’île
Kaag hatua. Mita 2 ikud’uuna kukweeka usalaama na mata/ikololo yat’innkie.
1
ûzî
Hat’isoo!
Kwa aka iyyo guya oone mûûdû akokololee/hat’iseeni
Wanyiige kyiizi.  Wakokololela dhini ama kuhat’isîza dhini na wakiinge waalya chwee waa bira yaao
2
Ni asanta *Shub’a uvunîka*
Ama
Anaafi daa moroghoti, nijai akukingee mîîlî
Waad waalya wa’ambukizizwe wakud’una kochowa konyisa d’alili, amû yiite wanaa maambukizi
Na kwa uj’umula, ni fai kukaagî kla na ummati wa waadû, maana da’ukud’uuna kumanya katî kaao ni ani yûû moroghoti.
Bhipod’ozi
Mûûdû anaa jinna fai
Masîîrimo za tireni
Bhifuungo bhya kûchîza izûlû
Tishu
Bhikombe
Bhifaa bhya dijitali
Na hata na b’atiini ya oso wa  kyiizi kyewwe
Mab’ango ya staa
Banya
Kalamu
Kichapi kya babala
Mikono yaao
J’apokuwa wakati ûgî mataa mûûdû moroghoti yakud’uuna kut’innik’îla biyya zîgî…
anyî chwee mukud’uuna kulwaala
ama oswaa mud’ala ywewwe
ukashukuma macho
Na guya udhaabhi b’llaa kutarazia b’aadhyaa sehemu îzi, na kisaana ukadhaabha oso wewwe,
Na gîla mooza muhimu hamu ya kuwamala ni kwa koosa na kuwacheeja na sab’uni, jiiki, ama boorte.
Bhirusi nijai bhikakaagî hubhîîni kwa mud’aa masa’a bhit’ook’o
Sab’uni
Tahadhari
Dûû manaa yûû muhimu kweera aya
Osa na sab’uni mupakaa apo
Sab’uni
Chik’ilî
Manya usaadhaabha oso wewwe. (ama oso wa mûûdû ûgî.) Guya yaakukub’idhi, osa nguzi mikono yewwe aka fai na sab’uni.
Mud’a mufai wa koghoona ubhinaa ‘Sikwaa kubhyaalîka’ mara bîlî.
Gobera mibeeni
Kwa mud’aa sekunde 20
Kaarha za nyalimo
Osa nyumaa mikono yewwe
Kusafisa hamu ikama’nisha jîîza?
Guya ugheghezie aka iyyo, uswiite na wasiwasi. Ukisaana osa mikono yewwe na sab’uni.
Manya usaadhaabha kyiizi ikyo na b’atiini.
Mata/ikololo
*Bakiteria nijai zika’enea kyiizi ikyo dhini guya ukifaazie kyiizi ikyo kwa mud’a mulaila
Llacha kyiizi guya oone kit’uraawie. Manya usaakufaala kyiizi ikyo zaid’yaa siku mooza!
Tumia mok’aa kupakua bhiitû
D’aana
Baaba
Aaî
Killaa mûûdû ipejikeene akwiita na taulwaa koowa yeyye mweenye.
Manya musaakulubhana ama kutumika wali bhiitû, hubhî, bhikombe, taulu.
Maana da’ud’uuna udhaabhe oso wewwe na chik’ilî hata guya uwakud’eema
Guya iwakud’unikana arhûlla na ufuuge babala ikiwa utumikee ch’ik’ilî yewwe ama ifuzi lyewwe bad’ilyaa kutumika mokono wewwe.
Muzîni
Na hata ba’ad’a kwiita b’atiini na wadûû
Kab’ullaa usaakûlya bhiitû
Osa mikono yewwe na maazî na sab’uni killaa wakati…
Na mwiisho
Sab’uni
Killaa mûûdû na akaagî  na usalaama!  
Killaa mûûdû na akaagî  na usalaama!  
Sab’uni
Soma nakala îyî ud’ak’abhe kumanya udhiina
“This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel” by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)

“The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe”, by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign policy, Report.  (Jan 25, 2020)

“How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands”. By Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, opinion.  (Jan 28,2020)

K’aasisa muhimu ya laghwaa madawa
Kifungu kya koogeza: Kuzingatia usafi kwa umakiini kwa komiki kuna umuhimu wa kwiizîza ma’ambukizi yagî yamanyikeene kamaa k’annû na bepo, na ipejikeene kuzingatiywa na kutekelezwa katîka maisha ya killaa siku, hata guya kusakoona j’anga lya roghoti. 
References: lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references.  https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/  https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Additonal lnformation A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here: https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Kwaaba mwoongozo Umma kwa uj’umula nijai wakapeewa Komiki  îyî b’asi aka wakuitumika mitandao yaao dhini ya Whatsapp na  Telegramu, na kupakua kweyye lîa ni b’asi aka id’una kuchapishwa aka ikweekwa mab’angooni dûû waadû wakutumika binasu ama itumike kwa golaa kubarsiisisa mizîni, sukuli na hata  biyyaa ghiiryû balîî balî. 
Guya okonyisee wagî, ûkûcha rhaalî zingatia mambo aya matato: 1) Da’irughusizwe kwa aka yoyote kuhariiri komiki wakati utumikee na wagî. 2) Komiki da’itumikee kwa murad’i wowote wa kib’yashara 3) Guya yûû mutandaoni, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow
Kwa waalya wagî chwee watumikee, mûkûcha rhaallî botaa ombi lyeenu kwa: comicsforgood@gmail.com
Kuhusu bhirusi bhya Kud’a

credits: Created by Weiman Kow, instagram: weimankow
licenseNotes: Manya usaaku’anya mandishi aya yandikiilwe, amû ukud’uuna kuitafusiri, kuyaabîpa na kuigheghela aka balîî balî, na uik’iise wadûûni amû isaa b’yaashara. Laazima okood’e hakimiliki na muamana ya mwaandiki na mochori Weiman Kou.
summary: This book gives basic advice on dealing with the coronavirus COVID 19
title: Kuhusu bhirusi bhya Kud’a
